column2: Customers complain that they do not know when Comments have been added to their Cases. Which configuration can a System Administrator implement to address this concern?

column9: Enable Case Comment notification to notify contacts when a case comment has been modified or added to a case.

column2: Universal Containers has an inside sales team that only sells warranty renewals and an outside sales team that only sells products. Each type of sale captures different information and has a different sales cycle.How should the System Administrator configure Salesforce to meet these requirements?
column3: Create a custom picklist field on the Opportunity to specify if it is a product or warranty sale.
column4: Create a Validation Rule that displays the correct Page Layout and Sales Process based on Role.
column5: Create a Page Layout, Sales Process, and Record Type for each type of sale.
column6: Create a custom Object for warranty renewals with the appropriate Sales Process.
column8: Use record types to offer different business processes, picklist values, and page layouts to different users.
column9: Use record types to offer different business processes, picklist values, and page layouts to different users.
column10: Record types offer different business processes, picklist values, and page layouts to different users.
column11: Use record types to offer different business processes, picklist values, and page layouts to different users.

column2: The administrator at Ursa Major Solar needs to provide information for total Salesforce licenses, used licenses, and the remaining Salesforce licenses. Where in setup can this information be found?
column3: Users
column4: Company Information
column5: Profiles
column6: Critical Updates
column8: Though you can find information for each individual user's license under the Users section of Setup, you would not find information about how many licenses have been used, and how many are still available.
column9: You would find information about how many licenses have been used and how many are still available under the Company Information section in Setup.
column10: Profiles define how users can access objects and data. This is not where you would find information about how many licenses have been used or are still available.
column11: Critical Updates is found in Company Settings and is where you would review and activite release updates to improve performance, security, business logic and usability.

column2: How can a System Administrator discover who added a field to the account page layout?
column3: Create a poll in the Admin Chatter group.
column4: Download the Setup Audit Trail.
column5: Run an Account History report.
column6: Review the Account Last Modified By field.
column8: Creating a poll is not a verified way to track field changes to the account page layout.
column9: The Setup Audit Trail tracks field history.
column10: Running a report will not show changes to the Account page.
column11: The Account Last Modified By might show a change made after the information you would be looking for.

column6: Record Triggered-Flow that runs Before save

column9: Update new and changed records by using before-save updates in flows.

column2: A user's profile can be controlled by which three settings?Choose 3 options.
column3: Assigned apps
column4: Record type assignment
column5: Security at the field-level
column6: Locale settings
column8: Profiles define how users access objects and data, and what they can do within the application.
column9: Profiles define how users access objects and data, and what they can do within the application.
column10: Profiles define how users access objects and data, and what they can do within the application.
column11: Locales determine the display formats for date and time, users’ names, addresses, and commas and periods in numbers.
column12: Feature license assignment grants access to features that need to be added to a user license.

column2: Ursa Major is onboarding 15 new employees in three weeks. The administrator needs to create user records in Salesforce without activating them.  Which two methods allow the administrator to achieve this goal?Choose 2 options.
column3: Click Add Multiple Users and ensure that Generate New Password and Notify User Immediately are unchecked.
column4: Create them with the User Import Wizard and ensure that Active is unchecked.
column5: Schedule a Time-Dependent Workflow to create users in three weeks.
column6: Create a .csv file ensuring that IsActive = False, and use the data loader to insert.
column8: An Admin can manually create mutiple users with the Generate New Password and Notify User Immediately box unchecked.
column9: Users cannot be created with the import wizard.
column10: Workflow cannot create users.
column11: With a properly formatted csv file, Data Loader can be used to create multiple users. Include the IsActive = false to create the users in an inactive status.

column2: Universal Containers wants to automatically assign a Task to account managers when a customer's agreement is about to expire. How should a System Administrator configure this functionality?
column3: Create a Workflow on Account with a rule criteria of Agreement End Date < TODAY().
column4: Create a Workflow on Account with a rule criteria of Agreement End Date > TODAY().
column5: Create a Time-based Workflow on Account with a rule criteria of Agreement End Date < TODAY().
column6: Create a Time-based Workflow on Account with a rule criteria of Agreement End Date > TODAY().
column8: Use a time-based workflow.
column9: Use a time-based workflow.
column10: Use a time-based workflow with a greater operator.
column11: Use a time-based workflow with a greater operator.

column2: Ursa Major Solar needs to fulfill the following requirements:  A custom object must be created to capture account survey data. Users need the ability to select an account from the survey record and view related surveys on the account record.Which two actions can an administrator configure to meet these requirements?Choose 2 options.
column3: Create a lookup relationship field on the survey object.
column4: Put the account related list on the survey page layout.
column5: Put the survey related list on the account page layout.
column6: Create a lookup relationship field on the account object.
column8: A lookup relationship links two objects together. Adding the lookup relationship field on the survey object will allow the user to link to an account.
column9: Records in Salesforce include details and links to other related records. Add the related list to the account page to provide access to the releated survey.
column10: Records in Salesforce include details and links to other related records. Add the related list to the account page to provide access to the releated survey.
column11: A lookup relationship links two objects together. Adding the lookup relationship field on the survey object will allow the user to link to an account.

column2: An Administrator at Ursa Major Solar is converting a lead and needs to capture custom lead data on the converted contact.  What should the administrator do to accomplish this goal?
column3: Utilize the lead conversion wizard to select the fields.
column4: Map custom lead fields to standard contact fields.
column5: Utilize the data loader to move the custom lead data.
column6: Map custom lead fields to custom contact fields.
column8: Fields are not selected by the converting user, they are setup by the admin
column9: Custom lead fields cannot be mapped to standard contact fields.
column10: The standard lead convertion process converts data.
column11: When leads are converted lead records, standard lead fields map to contact, account, person account, and opportunity fields. Custom fields are map to newly created records.

column2: A Finance user with the View All Data" permission enabled sees no Opportunities when opening a Sales pipeline report. However
column3: a Sales Rep sees Opportunities as expected.Which two actions should a System Administrator perform to resolve this problem?"
column4: Create a Custom Report Type for the user that shows all records.
column5: Change the Org-Wide Opportunity Sharing Default to Public Read.
column6: Update the report filter to show All Opportunities.
column7: Select Save Hierarchy Level on the pipeline report.
column9: Show the hierarchy to see your org’s role hierarchy above the report results. You can use the role hierarchy to share report data with people at different levels in the hierarchy.
column10: Show the hierarchy to see your org’s role hierarchy above the report results. You can use the role hierarchy to share report data with people at different levels in the hierarchy.
column11: Use filters to pare down a report until it only shows the data that is needed.
column12: Show the hierarchy to see your org’s role hierarchy above the report results. You can use the role hierarchy to share report data with people at different levels in the hierarchy.

column2: In which situation is the Case Contact notified when a support representative adds a new case comment?

column2: How can multiple Campaign records be associated with a single Opportunity?

column2: An administrator at Ursa Major Solar wants to allow a sales user to relate an opportunity to a campaign.  What are two ways to accomplish this goal?Choose 2 options.

column2: Users at Universal Containers (UC) adhere to the following process for expense reports:  Create the expense report. column2: How should the System Administrator implement biweekly notifications for Sales Reps that include Opportunities that need attention based on the Opportunity Owner's last login, past due Opportunities, and all Opportunities that have not been updated in the last 30 days?
column3: Create Scheduled Reports.
column4: Create Scheduled Dashboards.
column5: Create a Chatter Group.
column6: Create Opportunity Update Reminders.
column8: Scheduled reports would not be able to be schedule based on the user's last login.
column9: Scheduled dashboards would not be able to be schedule based on the user's last login.
column10: A Chatter group would not post reminders based on the user's last login.
column11: Opportunity update reminders allow managers to automatically send and schedule emails that include a report of the team's open opportunities to direct reports. You can select the fields you want to include in the reminders such as last login date, or # not updated in the last 30 days.

column2: Ursa Major Solar placed a time-dependent action in the workflow queue when the record was created. What are two situations that will cause this action to be removed from the queue?Choose 2 options.
column3: If a validation rule is triggered for the record
column4: If the action is deleted from the workflow queue
column5: If another record triggers the same workflow rule
column6: If the record no longer matches the rule criteria
column8: Time-dependent actions remain in the workflow queue only as long as the workflow rule criteria are still valid. If a record no longer matches the rule criteria, Salesforce removes the time-dependent actions queued for that record.
column9: Time-dependent actions remain in the workflow queue only as long as the workflow rule criteria are still valid. If a record no longer matches the rule criteria, Salesforce removes the time-dependent actions queued for that record.
column10: Time-dependent actions remain in the workflow queue only as long as the workflow rule criteria are still valid. If a record no longer matches the rule criteria, Salesforce removes the time-dependent actions queued for that record.
column11: Time-dependent actions remain in the workflow queue only as long as the workflow rule criteria are still valid. If a record no longer matches the rule criteria, Salesforce removes the time-dependent actions queued for that record.

column2: The administrator for the Cloud Kicks has a flow that makes several updates to Contacts when they are being created. If the Contact Status is “New” and the Contact’s email is known, the administrator would also like to send a welcome email.What should the administrator do to complete this requirement?
column3: Update the flow with a formula to send the email when needed.
column4: Update the flow with a decision to send the email when needed.
column5: Create a process builder with email alert to send the email.
column6: Create a workflow rule with email alert to send the email.
column8: When a flow executes a Decision element, it evaluates each decision outcome in order.
column9: When a flow executes a Decision element, it evaluates each decision outcome in order.
column10: When a flow executes a Decision element, it evaluates each decision outcome in order.

column2: Ursa Major Solar wants all Sales Users to see a dashboard that displays Total Closed/Won Opportunity Amount by User on a monthly basis. The Opportunity sharing model is private.  What should the administrator do to fulfill this request?
column3: Create the Dashboard from the Opportunities by User Report, then save it in the shared Dashboard Folder as a Dynamic Dashboard.
column4: Request for the Sales Manager to create the Dashboard from the Opportunities by User Report, select View Dashboard as Me"
column5: and save in the shared Dashboard Folder."
column6: Create the Dashboard from the Opportunities by User Report, choose the Sales Manager as RunAs User and Save in the private Dashboard Folder.
column7: Request for the Sales Manager to create the Dashboard from the Opportunities by User Report and save it to her private Dashboards Folder.
column9: Dynamic dashboard would only show data the running users has access too.
column10: By setting the running user to the Sales Manager and saving in a shared folder the Sales user will see all the records the Sales Manager can see.
column11: Saving to a private folder will not allow access for the Sales users.
column12: Saving to a private folder will not allow access for the Sales users.

column2: The support group at Ursa Major Solar has the following requirements:  Agents need to capture different information for product support and inquiry cases. The lifecycle for inquiry cases should have fewer steps than the lifecycle for product support cases. Which three features should an administrator use to meet these requirements?Choose 3 options.
column3: Field-level security
column4: Permission sets
column5: Support processes
column6: Record types
column8: Field-level secuirty controls access to each field on the field-level, not on the object level.
column9: Permission sets do not specify page layout assignments, which are tied to record types and ultimately will control the fields and picklist options that a user sees.
column10: After creating a support process, it is assciated with a record type. Based on the record type chosen when creating a record (product support or inquiry in this example), the support process associated is used to determine the status" field picklist on the case object."
column11: Record types determine which page layouts and picklst values users have access to, so creating two different record types for product support vs. inquiry will meet these requirements.
column12: Page layouts control the layout and the organization of buttons, fields, links, etc. on object record pages. The admin is able to use page layouts to customize the content of record pages and make them unique for product support vs. inquiry.

column2: After a recent restructure of its Sales Department, Ursa Major Solar is having issues with records being omitted in the new Opportunity Report.   Which three questions should the administrator ask to research this issue?Choose 3 options.
column3: Did the sales manager start from a copy or clone of an existing report?
column4: Do owners of all records have Roles and correct Territory Assignments?
column5: Have the owners of the records been frozen?
column6: Are records currently being shared with the sales manager?
column7: Do the records the sales managers expect to see match the filter criteria?
column8: Records can be added back in regardless of what report type is started with.
column9: If one of your reports is either missing records or contains results that shouldn't display.
column10: Freezing users would not prevent records from being populated. If one of your reports is either missing records or contains results that shouldn't display.
column11: If one of your reports is either missing records or contains results that shouldn't display.
column12: If one of your reports is either missing records or contains results that shouldn't display.

column2: An administrator at Ursa Major Solar is using sharing rules to grant record access to users. Which two types of record access can the administrator grant?Choose 2 options.
column3: Read/Write
column4: Read/Write/Transfer
column5: Read Only
column6: Read/Write/Delete
column8: Read/Write access is granted with sharing rurles.
column9: An admin cannot grant Read/Write/Transfer access with sharing rules.
column10: Read Only access is granted with sharing rules
column11: An admin cannot grant Read/Write/Delete access with sharing rules.

column2: Universal Containers uses an Auto-numbering system to uniquely identify each support request. They want customers to know this number as soon as possible.Which two features should the System Administrator implement to allow customers have quick access to this information?Choose 2 options.
column3: Case Comment Notifications
column4: Self-service Portal
column5: Case Feed Layout Actions
column6: Auto-response Rules
column8: Case comment notifications do not allow for self-service.
column9: A self-service portal provides an online support channel for your customers - allowing them to resolve their inquiries without contacting a customer service representative.
column10: Case feed layout actions do not allow for self-service.
column11: Auto-response rules let you automatically send email responses for case submissions based on the record’s attributes.

column2: Ursa Major Solar recently purchased 15 new Salesforce licenses.  How many users can an administrator create at the same time on the add multiple users page?
column3: A maximum of 10 users.

column2: Ursa Major Solar has the following environment and requirements:  A new custom object named Regulations__c is a child of the account object. All users need the ability to view Regulations__c when viewing accounts with the sales account page layout. How should an administrator provide access to Regulations__c on the sales account page layout?
column3: By adding a new section for Regulations__c to the sales account page layout
column4: By adding a new action for Regulations__c to the sales account page layout
column5: By adding a new custom link for Regulations__c to the sales account page layout
column6: By adding a new related list for Regulations__c to the sales account page layout
column8: Adding the related list will allow users to access the child accounts. Related lists are within a section.
column9: Adding an action will not allow users to view the child accounts.
column10: Adding a custom link will not allow users to view the child accounts.
column11: Adding the related list will allow users to access the child accounts.

column2: Universal Containers regularly imports Accounts from an external order system that has its own ID field for each record. What should the System Administrator do to help prevent duplicates during these imports?
column3: Use VLOOKUP to find matching records in Salesforce.
column4: Create a formula field that identifies matches.
column5: Create a unique External ID field on Accounts in Salesforce for matching.
column6: Use the ID from the order system in place of the Salesforce ID.
column8: Use an external ID field that contains record identifiers from a system outside of Salesforce.
column9: Use an external ID field that contains record identifiers from a system outside of Salesforce.
column10: An external ID field contains record identifiers from a system outside of Salesforce.
column11: Use an external ID field that contains record identifiers from a system outside of Salesforce.
